title: China's inflation numbers miss expectations to rise 0.2% in June
content: China's consumer price inflation rose by 0.2% in June from a year ago, missing expectations, while producer prices fell in-line with forecasts.
summary: China's consumer price inflation rose by 0.2% in June from a year ago, missing expectations, while producer prices fell in-line with forecasts.

title: Fed Chair Powell says holding rates high for too long could jeopardize economic growth
content: Setting the stage for a two-day appearance on Capitol Hill, the central bank leader said the economy remains strong as does the labor market.
summary: Setting the stage for a two-day appearance on Capitol Hill, the central bank leader said the economy remains strong as does the labor market.

title: China’s ETF market sees ‘explosive’ growth, inflows jump 5-fold in three years, Morningstar says
content: Chinese exchange-traded funds saw a "staggering" growth in the last few years, with inflows consistently notching new highs, according to Morningstar.
summary: Chinese exchange-traded funds saw a "staggering" growth in the last few years, with inflows consistently notching new highs, according to Morningstar.

title: Japan's Nikkei nears all-time intraday high as other Asia markets slip; China inflation weaker than expected
content: China's consumer price index is expected to climb 0.4% in June, compared with 0.3% in May.
summary: China's consumer price index is expected to climb 0.4% in June, compared with 0.3% in May.

title: Biden announces new NATO aid for Ukraine, as his reelection campaign teeters
content: President Biden is scheduled to deliver a press conference Thursday following NATO summit events.
summary: President Biden is scheduled to deliver a press conference Thursday following NATO summit events.

title: CNBC Daily Open: Powell says high rates threaten growth
content: Powell says prolonged high rates could harm economic growth. The S&P 500 notches its 36th record close. Biden pledges Patriot missiles to Ukraine.
summary: Powell says prolonged high rates could harm economic growth. The S&P 500 notches its 36th record close. Biden pledges Patriot missiles to Ukraine.

title: Japan and Philippines' defense pact seeks to counter China's aggression in the region, experts say
content: Japan and the Philippines have signed a landmark defense pact, allowing exchanges of armed forces for training and military exercises amid China concerns.
summary: Japan and the Philippines have signed a landmark defense pact, allowing exchanges of armed forces for training and military exercises amid China concerns.

title: Barcelona protesters throw items and spray travelers with water while shouting ‘tourists go home’
content: The protesters — angry about the city's long-standing problems with overtourism — also used tape to block hotel entrances and sidewalk cafes in Barceloneta.
summary: The protesters — angry about the city's long-standing problems with overtourism — also used tape to block hotel entrances and sidewalk cafes in Barceloneta.

title: This is the most affordable country for expats in 2024, according to a new report
content: Vietnam was ranked No. 1 in terms of personal finances for expats, according to InterNation's Expat Insider 2024 report.
summary: Vietnam was ranked No. 1 in terms of personal finances for expats, according to InterNation's Expat Insider 2024 report.

title: Greece defends new six-day working week legislation, says it's an 'exceptional measure'
content: After facing backlash for introducing a new six-day working week, Greece has defended the policy, saying it would be an “exceptional measure.”
summary: After facing backlash for introducing a new six-day working week, Greece has defended the policy, saying it would be an “exceptional measure.”

title: Singapore state investor Temasek to focus on early adopters of AI in the U.S.; cautious on China
content: The state investor said that the U.S. will still be the largest destination for its capital, although it is also looking to increase its focus on India and Japan.
summary: The state investor said that the U.S. will still be the largest destination for its capital, although it is also looking to increase its focus on India and Japan.

title: Iran has voted in a reformist president — but change remains distant
content: Despite Pezeshkian's stated support for relaxing things like headscarf penalties, Iran-focused human rights groups are not optimistic.
summary: Despite Pezeshkian's stated support for relaxing things like headscarf penalties, Iran-focused human rights groups are not optimistic.

title: Stolen crypto doubled to $1.38 billion in the first half of 2024, research firm says
content: Crypto valued at $1.38 billion was stolen by hackers from Jan. 1 to June 24, up from $657 million during the year-earlier period, TRM Labs data showed.
summary: Crypto valued at $1.38 billion was stolen by hackers from Jan. 1 to June 24, up from $657 million during the year-earlier period, TRM Labs data showed.

title: First Ariane 6 rocket launches as Europe rejoins a market dominated by Musk's SpaceX
content: The European Space Agency has prepared its newest heavy-lift Ariane 6 rocket to launch from Europe's Spaceport in Kourou, French Guiana, on Tuesday.
summary: The European Space Agency has prepared its newest heavy-lift Ariane 6 rocket to launch from Europe's Spaceport in Kourou, French Guiana, on Tuesday.

title: Vacuum cleaner manufacturer Dyson to cut around 1,000 jobs in the UK
content: Dyson is set to cut up to 1,000 jobs in the U.K., where it employs 4,500 people.
summary: Dyson is set to cut up to 1,000 jobs in the U.K., where it employs 4,500 people.

title: UiPath to lay off 10% of workforce in companywide restructuring
content: Software developer UiPath will cut 10% of its workforce, or about 420 jobs, as part of a broader company restructuring.
summary: Software developer UiPath will cut 10% of its workforce, or about 420 jobs, as part of a broader company restructuring.

title: France's Macron wanted to leave his mark on Europe — he may have just ruined his legacy
content: French President Emmanuel Macron's failed snap election gamble is likely to take a huge toll on his political ambitions and legacy, analysts say.
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron's failed snap election gamble is likely to take a huge toll on his political ambitions and legacy, analysts say.

title: Biden needs to show he's 'with it' at 'extraordinarily important' NATO summit, former diplomat says
content: Particular focus during the summit will be on President Joe Biden amid widespread concerns about his age and mental fitness for the presidential race.
summary: Particular focus during the summit will be on President Joe Biden amid widespread concerns about his age and mental fitness for the presidential race.

title: BP shares drop 4.3% after warning of up to $2 billion impairment, weak refining margins
content: BP on Tuesday said it expects to post an impairment of up to $2 billion in the second quarter, also warning of lower refining margins.
summary: BP on Tuesday said it expects to post an impairment of up to $2 billion in the second quarter, also warning of lower refining margins.

title: The sting of an Airbnb rejection: Hosts explain why they turn down all sorts of travelers
content: Social media, credit cards that don't match booking names, and even 4.5-star reviews can cause short-term rental hosts to reject travelers outright.
summary: Social media, credit cards that don't match booking names, and even 4.5-star reviews can cause short-term rental hosts to reject travelers outright.

title: Inflation outrage: Even as prices stabilize, Walmart, Chipotle and others feel the heat from skeptical customers
content: Customers' deep frustration with higher prices has pushed many retailers and restaurants to step up discounts, promotions and value meals.
summary: Customers' deep frustration with higher prices has pushed many retailers and restaurants to step up discounts, promotions and value meals.

title: Japan stocks and India's Nifty 50 hit fresh highs as Asia-Pacific markets rise
content: Asia-Pacific markets rose on Tuesday, tracking gains on Wall Street that saw the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite closing at record highs overnight.
summary: Asia-Pacific markets rose on Tuesday, tracking gains on Wall Street that saw the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite closing at record highs overnight.

title: San Francisco's AI boom can't stop real estate slide, as office vacancies reach new record
content: Office vacancies in San Francisco hit another record in the second quarter, and rent prices fell to their lowest since 2015, according to Cushman & Wakefield.
summary: Office vacancies in San Francisco hit another record in the second quarter, and rent prices fell to their lowest since 2015, according to Cushman & Wakefield.

title: The German government owns around $2 billion in bitcoin — and it's freaking out crypto investors
content: For weeks, Germany's government has been selling hundreds of millions of dollars worth of bitcoin, placing pressure on the world's largest cryptocurrency.

title: Amazon's Asian rival Shein wants to be supply chain giant, but some fear Chinese cyber spying inside global trade links

content: President Biden faces growing pressure to drop out of the 2024 presidential race against Donald Trump after his poor debate showing.

title: Corning shares pop 12% as AI boom drives stronger-than-expected demand for equipment
content: The company credits the outperformance to demand for its optical connectivity products used in generative artificial intelligence.
